props.name: Microsoft Business Analytics and AI
props.description: Building Solutions with Microsoft Business Analytics and AI

props.name: Microsoft R and SQL Server ML Services
props.description: Doing Data Analysis using R, Analyzing Big Data with Microsoft R Server

props.name: Basic Statistics
props.description: Key mathematical concepts required to understand and build machine learning models

props.name: Hypothesis Testing and Handling Data
props.description: Understanding concepts of Hypothesis testing and basic data manipulation methods.

props.name: Machine Learning basics
props.description: Understanding basic Machine learning concepts , Validating Statiscal and Machine Learning Models.

props.name: Data and Feature Management
props.description: Building/Managing Features and Data Manipulation using Python

props.name: Basic Deep Learning
props.description: Introduction to Deep Neural Network - Multi Layer Classification and Multi Layer Perception

props.name: Recurrent Neural Networks
props.description: Introduction to Recurrent Neural Networks and Long Short Term Memory

props.name: LSTM network for Predictive Maintenance
props.description: Building a LSTM Deep Neural Network for predictive maintenance problems.

props.name: Overview - Intro to CNNs for Visual Recognition
props.description: This is an introduction to the field of computer vision, discussing its history and key challenges. We emphasize that computer vision encompasses a wide variety of different tasks, and that despite the recent successes of deep learning we are still a long way from realizing the goal of human-level visual intelligence.

props.name: AI Developer Bootcamp videos
props.description: This is a series of 8 videos that cover the full Microsoft AI platform and the components that will empower any developer to start infusing AI into their applications today.

props.name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (AI)
props.description: Artificial Intelligence will define the next generation of software solutions. This computer science course provides an overview of AI, and explains how it can be used to build smart apps that help organizations be more efficient and enrich people’s lives. It uses a mix of engaging lectures and hands-on activities to help you take your first steps in the exciting field of AI.

props.name: Setup Environment
props.description: This module will guide you through how to setup your environment on an Azure Data Science Virtual Machine.

props.name: Deep Learning Explained
props.description: This is an introductory course to CNTK and deep learning, covering the core concepts in CNTK and deep learning. This course runs over a 6-week duration, but each week can be completed in a few hours. While we highly recommend this course, this learning path also provides links to tutorials you can do at your own pace.

props.name: Transfer Learning
props.description: Rather than training a hugely deep architecture for each new problem you encounter, transfer learning allows you to reuse an existing architecture trained on a large image corpus (usually ImageNet) and only retrain the last few layers to 'adapt' to your new dataset.

props.name: OCR Recognition
props.description: This module will guide you through the tutorials to work with the MNIST data set of handwritten numbers and understand how to process them and teach a computer how to recognize them as the correct digits.

props.name: Object Detection
props.description: This tutorial uses Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit's (CNTK) fast R-CNN implementation (see the Fast R-CNN section for a description) which was shown to produce state-of-the-art results for Pascal VOC, one of the main object detection challenges in the field.
